collections.title: Introduction to work
collections.description:
The work results from an extensive collection and visual record of images generated by denim representations and associations within the culture. 
 The project acts as a multi-disciplinary discussion and moving scenarios in contemporary culture; The fashion context; And the integration of designed objects into everyday situations. 
 The research expands on the notion of abstracting the semiotic of denim archetypes; Reflecting on the process of isolating the elements of denim associations, and questioning how its parts play a role in collective perceptions—and speculating a new definition of denim. 
 The meaning behind the outcomes is to interrogate how the signs of fashion artifacts signify and how denim visual notions become dynamic. These outcomes intentionally open space for discussion and an opportunity for the recollection of multiple collective perceptions. Also, an interplay of 'reciprocal language' always relates to denim's imaginary, technology, production, and replication. Each project within the work acts as a reflection and intervention upon its foundations. Moreover, It rewrites and creates narratives by finding evidence self-contained. 
 A continually shifting system developed the process. from fashion context, everyday design, and denim design principles that intentionally leave room for interpretation, and, by suggesting multiple readings and experimenting with 'denim' applications in contemporary culture.

categories.name: Heavy Duty
categories.description: The conventional way of developing and manufacturing denim. Changing the purpose without replacing the technical descriptions that intentionally leave room for interpretation.

categories.name: The Laundry Effect
categories.description: The project refers to the “laundry effect” as reinterpreting  the industrial process of washing denim. After collecting the blue dust that remains from the scraping process, and the experimentation with this technique and its possible applications.

collections.title: Series Program
collections.description:
Lookbook recreates gestures of the body in relationship with wearing, to reflecting on how they function as a metaphor for creating alternative dialogues, and a language of signs in everyday context. 
 Body gestures are featured in a recording live presentation with people wearing 9 individual looks. 
 The outcome is a lookbook that highlights the collection as a serie of garments/outfits that open an interactive form play of wearing and layering meaning.

categories.name: About
categories.description: Explores multiple ways to relate and engage with everyday denim objects, presenting a series of artifacts with a sense of replications and associated with specific information that is coded by cultural and social references. The collection approaches gestures of the body and how they function as a metaphor for creating alternative dialogues and a language of signs in everyday context.

collections.title: The Collection
collections.description: “The collection” explores in a fashion collection format the never-ending possibilities of denim objects and its modular meaning through a series of garments that combines different materials techniques and narratives around denim perceptions.
